nio/ESFind.description: Finds elements from given search parameters.

auth.title: Authentication
auth.description: Username and password credentials to connect to the Elastic Search database.

doc_type.title: Type
doc_type.description: The type of the document to query.

elasticsearch_client_kwargs.title: Client Argurments
elasticsearch_client_kwargs.description: kwargs to be passed to elasticsearch client. (e.g.: {'maxsize': 15})

enrich.title: Signal Enrichment
enrich.description: *enrich_field:* The attribute on the signal to store the results from this block. If this is empty, the results will be merged onto the incoming signal. This is the default operation. Having this field allows a block to 'save' the results of an operation to a single field on an incoming signal and notify the enriched signal.  *results field:* The attribute on the signal to store the results from this block. If this is empty, the results will be merged onto the incoming signal. This is the default operation. Having this field allows a block to save the results of an operation to a single field on an incoming signal and notify the enriched signal.

host.title: ES Host
host.description: The Elastic Search database's host address.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Starting offset to use when returning data (empty string to not include in query).

port.title: ES Port
port.description: The port where the Elastic Search database is located

pretty_results.title: Pretty Results
pretty_results.description: If true, only include query results and no other extraneous information.

size.title: Size
size.description: Number of elements to return (empty string to not include in query).

default.description: Data satisfying find criteria as 'Signal' instances.

connected.description: Determines if elasticsearch server is available.

nio/ESInsert.description: Stores input signals in a elasticsearch database. One document will be inserted into the database for each input signal.

auth.title: Authentication
auth.description: Username and password credentials to connect to the Elastic Search database.

doc_type.title: Type
doc_type.description: The type of the document to query.

elasticsearch_client_kwargs.title: Client Argurments
elasticsearch_client_kwargs.description: kwargs to be passed to elasticsearch client. (e.g.: {'maxsize': 15})

enrich.title: Signal Enrichment
enrich.description: *enrich_field:* The attribute on the signal to store the results from this block. If this is empty, the results will be merged onto the incoming signal. This is the default operation. Having this field allows a block to 'save' the results of an operation to a single field on an incoming signal and notify the enriched signal.  *results field:* The attribute on the signal to store the results from this block. If this is empty, the results will be merged onto the incoming signal. This is the default operation. Having this field allows a block to save the results of an operation to a single field on an incoming signal and notify the enriched signal.

host.title: ES Host
host.description: The Elastic Search database's host address.

port.title: ES Port
port.description: The port where the Elastic Search database is located

with_type.title: Include the type of logged signals?
with_type.description: If True, includes the signal type in the document.

default.description: Any list of signals.  One document will be inserted into the database for each input signal.
A signal with 'id' field obtained from inserted document.

connected.description: Determines if elasticsearch server is available.
